availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alford H. Champion ( Lyon County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky, native. Married to Mary L. Scott Champion in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on November 26, 1844. Father of Martha E. Champion, Maria F. Champion, Cyrus A. Champion, George M. Champion, and Harry Champion. Physician in Caldwell County in 1850. Employed James O. Scott as a laborer in Caldwell County in 1850. Physician in Lyon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 329B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 761.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 256.
Find A Grave, "Dr Alford H. Champion (1815-1898)," Memorial #135665817, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135665817 (accessed March 1, 2021).
